Title from paper label on fore-edge flap:
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 37
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper, hand, etc. would suggest late 18th or early 19th century.
Accompanying materials: Inserted slip, laid paper with notes in black ink (between pp. 278-279).
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 121. Hasan Chelebi's commentary on al-Mawaqif" ; "٣٦٢" in black ink on tail edge of text block.

Binding: Pasteboards faced in orange-tinted paper with edges / turn-ins in dark brown leather (paper-faced, leather-edged, framed binding) ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in an untinted paper ; scalloped edge on inner joint of fore edge / envelope flap ; sewn in cream colored thread, two stations, mainly intact ; endbands lacking ; overall in fairly good condition ; repairs to hinges on envelope flap in red straight grain leather ; possibly recycled, with boards narrower than text block, fore edge flap ill-fitting (too wide for the current thickness of the text block), text block badly trimmed at tail.

Support: European laid paper of perhaps two types ; one type with 10 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 25 mm. apart (horizontal) ; another type with 11 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 23 mm. apart (horizontal) ; burnished ; watermarks include lion passant guardant (see p.4, 6, 18, etc.) and "CV" or "GA" (see p.10).
Decoration: Keywords (قوله, etc.) and some notabilia rubricated ; some annotations in green ink.

Script: Naskh-nastaʻlīq (talik) ; several hands ; opening hand serifless with leftward slant, fairly straight ascenders, pointing in strokes rather than distinct dots, lām-alif mukhaffafah ; from p.49 a hand partially seriffed with head-serif on initial lām, inclination to the left, drooping descenders, curved ascenders, lām-alif mukhaffafah ; from p.129 a hand serifless with vertical strokes for paired dots, closed counters, shading, indication of tanwīn, final yāʼ of على mardūdah, lām-alif mukhaffafah ; from p.395 again opening hand.
Layout: Written in 21 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: V (10), III (16) , 7 IV (72), III +1 (79), 11 IV (167), III (173), 3 IV (197), V (207), II (211), 2 IV (227) ; chiefly quaternions ; catchwords present ; possible foliation in black ink, Hindu-Arabic numerals, appears in upper outer corner of the recto of many leaves (see p.61, 63, 77, 79, etc.), somewhat haphazard ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during cataloguing.
Explicit: "قوله واذا على مما علم البعيد فان قلت العلم باللازم انما يلزم اذا تصور الملزوم قصدا ويكون العلم به تاما بالمعنى الذي تعرفه و ح [وحينئذ] نقول العلم الثالث انما يلزم اذا كان"

Incipit: "الحمد لله الذى تولهت الافهام فى كبرياء ذاته وتحيرت الاوهام فى عظمة صفاته ... اما بعد فاعلموا معاشر طلاب اليقين سلام عليكم لا نبتغى الجاهلين ان اصحاب العقل متطابقون ... ثم شرح المواقف من بين كتبه للمولى المحقق واكبر المدقق جامع المعقول والمنقول قرة عين القبول السيد الشريف عامله الله بلطفه اللطيف كتاب اعترف ... ولقد طال ما جال في صدري ان اكتب عليه حواشي يزيل صعابه و يكشف عن وجوه فريدة نقابه ..."

Fine copy of the gloss of Ḥasan Chalabī (d.1481) on al-Jurjānī’s (d.1413) commentary on the work of al-Ījī (d. 1355?), al-Mawāqif fī ʻilm al-kalām, on scholastic theology. Description provided mainly by Sarah Mirza.
Acquired by purchase (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on interior of upper cover, "No. 121. Hasan Chelebi's commentary on al-Mawaqif" ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "120" in Western numerals on 'title page' ; title and "٢٨" in black ink on upper board lining and on 'title page' ; circular waqf-seal impression in black ink appears on 'title page' (p.1) and several places throughout, reads: "هذا وقف الراجي فيض الصمدي الشيخ احمد ضيا الدين ابن مصطفى الخالدي فمن بدله بعد ما سمعه فانما اثمه على الذين يبدلونه" in name of Aḥmad Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khālidī (i.e. Ahmed Ziyâüddîn Gümüşhanevî, d. 1893 or 4) ; "وقف" across upper margins of pp.346-347 ; marginal notes in 2-3 hands in black ink throughout, corrections made in black or green ink, interlinear glosses in black ink, sometimes as diagonal (or vertical see p.301) lines through text (see p.236, 257, 276, 383).
Ījī, ʻAḍud al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad,
